summary: Testing compliance shows strong payer variation: Commercial 84%, Medicare 72%, and Medicaid 58%. Solving authorization barriers could generate $280,000 in annual value.

financial_impact.math: $280,000/year = 14% avg testing gap (lagging payers) × 58 patients × $34,500 precision therapy value

clinical_impact.description: Reducing payer-based disparities in biomarker testing improves care equity and outcomes.

metrics.description: Improved progression-free survival with matched therapies
Overall survival benefit with biomarker-guided treatment
Higher objective response rate with targeted therapies
Reduced time from testing to treatment
Improved care equity across payer types

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing practices achieve >80% biomarker testing compliance across all payer types through streamlined prior authorization processes.

action_steps.text: Implement dedicated prior authorization team for biomarker testing
Create automated prior authorization submission tool
Negotiate biomarker testing agreements with key payers
Implement dedicated prior authorization team for Medicaid patients
Develop financial assistance program for testing
Create payer liaison role for complex biomarker cases

suggestions.text: Analyze denial patterns by payer and test type
Evaluate preauthorization success rates by staff member
